revised_title: Temperature Observations in the Alpine Tunnel
tldr: The author discusses temperature observations made during the construction of the Alpine tunnel through the Mont-Cenis mountain. They found that the temperature of the rock increased with depth, and the rate of increment was higher than in other observations made in Europe. The author suggests that this difference might be due to the topographical conditions and geological structure of the earth's crust under the crest of a great mountain chain.
